question.text:
Observe the given diagram of the sectional view of Testis.







Which of the following statements about the above diagram is correct?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>  is responsible for secretion of hormone testosterone.
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>  is the diploid germ cell which gives rise to gametes.
<math><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> is responsible for providing nutrition to the growing sperms.

solution.text:
A: Interstitial cells/Leydig's cells: They are responsible for the secretion of male sex hormones like testosterone. They are stimulated by ICSH/LH.

B: Spermatogonia: They are the germ cells that give rise to spermatozoa.

C: Spermatozoa: They are formed as a result of spermatogenesis.

D: Sertoli cells: They are responsible for providing nourishment to the growing sperms
